result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Sabastion Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Sabastion Hall is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Sabastion Hall was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Count 2 dismissed in 15CM412
- Count 2 in 16CF402 and Count 3 in 15CF247, all counts to run concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if probation is revoked
- Bond discharged

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 2 in 16CF402 and Count 3 in 15CF247

records.addlTxt: Received a $50 payment via Allpaid this date from DEF, Allpaid Transaction ID #30233616.  DEF's balance due is paid in full on 15CM412, and his TR's are at SDC.  I spoke with DEF and informed him that he can call SDC to set up a payment plan with them for his TR's, and that this case is paid in full so the payment will be denied and the $50 will be credited back to his credit card account from Allpaid. cah

DE called for the GPN ph # to make pymt. DE was given the ph # & advised to be sure to get his pymt in today as it's 7 days late. DE stated he was waiting til he could gather up the money to make pymt, but will get it in today. Includes 15CM412, 19TR1689. jaf

DE called stating he was laid off due to the pandemic, but is starting a new job & gets pd the 15th or 16th. DE was advised that if he cannot make his pymt by 4:30 pm on 5/14/20, he will need to submit a req for an ext by then. DE was given the info required on his req, his case #s, & the fax #. Includes 15CM412, 19TR1689. jaf
4/7/2020 DE called looking to get case number and pay code via govpay.   4/8/2020 Clerk called back DE 4/8/2020 and DE will be making payment later today. jl
From DE stating his pymt got ret'd in the mail, so he will drop it off today. Includes 15CM412, 19TR1689. jaf

DE called stating his child was born last wk & does not have his Jan 1st pymt. DE also stated he is still awaiting pymt from his former employer & may be able to make pymt on 1/3/20. DE was advised to make pymt or submit a request for deferment by 4 pm on 1/30/20. DE was given all info required on his request. Includes 15CM412, 19TR1689. jaf
DE called to obtain the GPNet pymt info. DE was given the ph # & case # to make pymt. Includes 15CM412, 19TR1689. jaf

DE called stating he's been having issues leaving a v/m after hrs. DE was advised that I attempted to leave a v/m w/him last wk approving his ext, but was unable to. DE was advised that it may be an issue w/his phone. DE is approved to make his pymt by 4 pm on 12-06-19. DE reminded to try & have his pymts in on or before the 1st or submit a req to change his pymt due date. DE stated he was having an issue w/his employer & is seeking new employment. Includes 15CM412, 19TR1689. jaf

From DE requesting to make Dec pymt on 12-06-19 so he can make his rent pymt. Ret'd call to DE, but was unable to leave a v/m. DE is approved to make his pymt by 4 pm on 12-06-19. Includes 15CM412, 19TR1689. jaf

Probation review hearing on January 9, 2017 at 04:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson; 11:55 pm Fox, ADA: Megan E. Kelly DF ATTY: Alex Andrea DF: Michael Sabastion Hall appeared from jail. Case called at Includes 16CF402, 15CF247, 15CM412. Atty. Andrea updates the court. ADA Kelly agrees. State files an amended information. A COMPAS has not been completed. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 2  in 15CF247 to 3rd degree sexual assault 940.225(3) and pleads G to amended Ct 3 in 15CF247 to 4th degree sexual assault 940.225(3m) . DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CM412 and pleads G to Ct 2 in 16CF402. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 2 in 15CF247 and amended Ct 3 in 15CF247. Court finds DE guilty of CT 1 in 15CM412 and G of Ct 2 in16CF402. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses Ct  1 and 3 in 16CF402, Ct 1 in 15CF247 and Ct 2 in 15CM412. Sentencing arguments. 
Court witholds entry of conviction in Count 2 of 15CF247 in favor of the 2 year DJOC and pending full compliance. Court accepts, signs and orders DJOC. Quarterly updates to be sent to the Court.

Crt orders: S/W 2 years probation with conditions for 16CF402 - Count 2, 15CF247 - Count 3 and 15CM412 - Count 1. All counts to run concurrently - without prejudice to consecutive if probation is revoked. 
6 months to be used at the discretion of the probation agent. 
- Court costs for 16CF402, 15CF247 and 15CM412; payable through probation
- DNA surcharge for 16CF402, 15CF247, and 15CM412; payable through probation
- DNA sample 
- No contact with TML (dob 8/30/01) or with family or residence. 
- Absolute Sobriety
- Not to possess any firearns
- Complete sexual deviancy eval and follow through with any recommendations
- Complete psychological assessment and follow through with any recommendations, if appropriate and recommended. 
- AODA and follow through with any recommendations
- Random and regular drug and alcohol testing 
- 40 hours of community service 
*Maintain all conditions of bond in 15CF247; Court amends bond from a cash bond to a $1000.00 Signature bond. Def to sign at the Clerk of Court office after release. 
*Bond is discharged in 16CF402 and 15CM412.

A probation review summary expected by agent, one week before probation review hearings. 
Defendant to sign up for probation today after release.  Probation review hearing scheduled for January 9, 2017 at 04:30 pm.
Plea hearing on October 20, 2016 at 11:00 am.
